_header: My will my love my very source of bliss
Subjects: love lyrics; lovers, addresses to beloved; envoys
_description:
Service of his mistress, translated from the French of Charles d’Orléans (Champollion-Figeac (1842)
XChampollion-Figeac, Aime. Les Poesies du duc Charles d’Orleans. Paris, 1842, 64) — three 8-line stanzas and 4-line Envoy

BLHar682.First Lines: My wille my loue my verry sorse of blisAs thynkith this what part y am certeyne…
BLHar682.Last Lines: …I nolde it happe shuld for a thousand poundIn yow if so durst it to yow sayne
